com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.viewstate

Interface ViewState<V extends MvpView>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of the View (extends MvpView
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LceViewState<D,V>, ParcelableLceViewState<D,V>, RestorableParcelableViewState<V>, RestorableViewState<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsLceViewState, AbsParcelableLceViewState, ArrayListLceViewState, CastedArrayListLceViewState, ParcelableDataLceViewState, RetainingFragmentLceViewState, RetainingLceViewState, SerializeableLceViewState, VoidViewState

    public interface ViewState<V extends MvpView>
    A ViewState is, like the name suggests, responsible to store the views state. In other words: The view like an Activity or a Fragment stores his state, like "showing loading animation", showing error view, etc. The goal is to have a views that can easily restore there state after screen orientation changes (from portrait to landscape and vice versa) by using a ViewState and the well defined View interfaces. The idea is to call the same methods the presenter would call to restore the view's state.

    While fragments can restore every data object if you use Fragment#setRetainInstance(boolean) = true Activities can't do that. Therefore Activities have to use RestorableViewState.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply(V view, boolean retained)
      Called to apply this viewstate on a given view.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        void apply(V view,
         boolean retained)
        Called to apply this viewstate on a given view.
        Parameters:
        view - The MvpView
        retained - true, if the components like the viewstate and the presenter have been retained because the Fragment#setRetainInstance(boolean) has been set to true
